title: Ben Wallace
summary: Ben Cameron Wallace (born September 10, 1974) is an American former professional basketball player and current basketball executive.[1][2] Playing most of his career in the National Basketball Association, he is regarded by many to be the greatest undrafted player in NBA history.[3][4][5] A native of Alabama, Wallace attended Cuyahoga Community College and Virginia Union University. In his NBA career, Wallace played with the Washington Bullets/Wizards, Orlando Magic, Detroit Pistons, Chicago Bulls, and Cleveland Cavaliers.
